intro: Mammillaria queretarica, commonly known as the Querétaro Hedgehog Cactus, is a species native to Mexico. It is a small, globular cactus with a dense covering of white spines. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10 centimeters and features a greenish-gray stem. It produces yellow flowers in the spring, which are borne on short pedicels. This cactus is well adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water once established.
